Job_Descriptions: Put your interpersonal skills to good use as the primary liaison between internal and external stakeholders, growing the client relationship and account. Be the gatekeeper of pitches and accounts, ensuring that the strategic direction and timelines hit the brief. Provide timely updates on campaigns and projects, along with post-campaign reporting, insights, and analysis. Live and breathe social - stay abreast and be at the forefront of digital and social media. We'll count on you to also share this with your team and on the agency level during sharing sessions! Be able to work with a team of highly motivated and enthusiastic team members. Introverts and Extroverts - We have them all. Have a great sense of humour and not take yourself too seriously! We're all here to work hard and play hard. Minimum Diploma holder in Marketing, Business or Communications. 1-2 years prior advertising agency experience preferred. If you live and breathe digital and social media, we're looking for you. Which means, yes, you're the guru on the continuously-evolving digital marketing trends. An alchemist who has the ability to transform complex data into insights and action plans. Understand the basic use of Google Slides and Google Worksheets. Knowledge in using tools such as Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics is a plus. Conceived in 2014 as a digital marketing agency, Meet Isaac is also part of the Ascentis Group of Companies, a leading local CRM provider in Singapore since 2003, providing loyalty and CRM solutions for retail, F&B brands in Singapore and the region. Over the years, Meet Isaac has grown to expand their capabilities and offerings, evolving into a full-service digital agency. From data analysts to UX designers and interactive developers, the team actively updates themselves on the latest industry trends and best practices. The key to our success, in addition to the right people and the right approach, is listening. We listen to our clients’ challenges to provide an integrated strategy that addresses their needs. We listen to conversations in the industry that help us remain relevant and updated. We believe that success is a combination of innovation and a spirit of continuous improvements. https://meetisaac.com/

Job_Title: Facilities Engineer - Carbon Capture, Utilization and Storage (CCUS)
Job_Descriptions: Chevron is accepting online applications for the position of Facilities Engineer – Carbon Capture, Utilization and Storage (CCUS) located in located in Duo Tower, Singapore through February 16, 2022 at 11:59 p.m. (Eastern Standard Time). All interested applicants, please read the Data Privacy Notice before submitting application. Our Chevron New Energies organization is looking for individuals who have an entrepreneurial mindset and are passionate about growing lower carbon business in hydrogen, carbon capture, and offsets. We are focused on delivering solutions oriented around our customers’ needs. The Facilities Engineer is a key member of Carbon Capture, Utilization and Storage (CCUS) agile teams, provides engineering evaluation, assessment and conceptual engineering of CCUS opportunities. Responsibilities for this position may include but are not limited to: Identifies engineering approach, quantifies scope and develops project cost control and forecasts. Performs basic engineering of simple design concepts, leveraging support from our Technical Center and other Business Units for more complex opportunities. Responsible for facilities project planning and execution, providing input into project facilities CAPEX budget. Conducts carbon capture facilities & storage site evaluation, assessment and selection recommendation. Evaluates potential transportation & facility needs; support early conceptual design of opportunities and scoping for construction and startup of new sites. Represents voice of operations personnel with evaluation of existing and new facilities for cost reduction and improved efficiency. Troubleshoots and optimizes operating processes related to CO2 capture, transportation, injection and sequestration. Required Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Chemical or Mechanical Engineering Minimum of 10 years facilities engineering experience A minimum of 5 years of experience in CCUS concepts Demonstrated capability of working in a diverse and distributed team environment. Preferred Qualifications: Master’s degree in chemical or Mechanical Engineering Demonstrated capability to deliver facility product solutions for CO2 capture, transport & injection. Relocation Options:Relocation will not be considered within Chevron parameters. International Considerations: Selected candidate will work in Singapore under the local payroll system and benefits. Chevron participates in E-Verify in certain locations as required by law.

Job_Title: Social Worker/Family Clinician (Initial 1 year appointment with review thereafter)
Job_Descriptions: Job Summary: The successful applicant will provide pro-active casework, support and advice for families. To contribute to multi-disciplinary team case planning. To promote and support safeguarding best practice across the school. The role reports to the Director of Pastoral Care. Requirements: Bachelor Degree or Graduate Diploma in Social Work Demonstrated ability in social work case practice and management, with at least 3-5 years of relevant experience Experience with family work is essential Experience with intervention for at-risk youth is preferable Experience with mental health support is preferable Statutory child protection experience in any jurisdiction is preferable Knowledge of (or willingness to learn about) Singapore child protection legislation, policy and practice is essential Experience working in a multi-disciplinary team environment is preferable Experience with policy development, implementation and review would be an advantage Key Responsibilities 1. Policy and process • Understanding of the school processes and policies, and the context of working in an international school under Singapore law. · Contributing to the writing, review and implementation of safeguarding related policies and procedure. 2. Casework · Case management of matters as decided in consultation with Deputy Head (Pastoral) & Director of Pastoral Care, with a focus on family casework. · Liaising with and coordinating support for families with community agencies, including the Ministry of Social and Family Development (MSF), Singapore police and other parties, where necessary. · Supporting Designated Safeguarding Leads (DSL) with risk of harm assessment and investigation. · Assisting with the administrative tasks associated with cases and other support as required by the DSL and in accordance with the School’s Safeguarding and Child Protection Policy. · Attending multi-disciplinary pastoral care meetings across the school. · Willingness to conduct home visits where deemed necessary and in consultation with the Director of Pastoral Care. Hiring_Company: MICRON SEMICONDUCTOR ASIA OPERATIONS PTE. LTD.
Job_Descriptions: As a Engineer/Senior Engineer in the Non-Volatile Engineering (NVE) Product Engineering organization at Micron Technology, Inc., you will be part of a brilliant team of engineers that solves complex problems. You will be responsible for enabling Micron’s NAND products with seamless and issue free release to both internal and external non-volatile system customers. In this role (FDV – Functional and Design Validation), you will formulate and execute validation flows on the latest RG NAND designs, using silicon and simulation. Validation on the NAND datasheet commands and features can come from deterministic usage cases, as well as randomly generated sequences. You will be responsible for design and implementation of automation tools to aid test program development and failure analysis. When device issues are uncovered, you will perform detailed failure analysis and work closely with the various Engineering and Development groups to resolve the observed issues. If you want a career that is meaningful, challenging, and want to work with a phenomenal team, NVE Product Engineering (FDV) may be a good fit for you. Responsibilities include, but not limited to : • Study the latest RG NAND designs, with focus on customer mode operations • Design novel test algorithms and develop test programs for validating NAND features and commands • Design and implement automation tools to aid test program development, failure analysis, and other work processes • Develop and optimize deterministic usage case flow and Random Sequence Generator for validation purpose • Use high-speed tester hardware to perform functional and design validation of new NAND devices • Perform Electrical Failure Analysis during the evaluations, and investigate root causes of reported device issues • Collaborate with NAND Design, Application Engineering, Product and System teams to drive closure of device issues

Hiring_Company: MICRON SEMICONDUCTOR ASIA OPERATIONS PTE. LTD.
Job_Title: NTI NAND Photolithography/Photo Metro Process Development Engineer
Job_Descriptions: As a Process Engineer you will be primarily responsible for starting up, developing and optimizing processes to improve product quality and reliability, working on process yield improvement, cost reduction, productivity improvement and risk management as well as resolving manufacturing line problems. You will also be required to identify, diagnose and resolve assembly process related problems by applying failure analysis, FMEA, 8D or SPC/FDC methodology. Additional responsibilities include coordinating and carrying out process, equipment and material evaluation/optimization to implement changes at process step, leading and participating in yield improvement and cost reduction activities, handling new process baseline qualifications and managing, auditing and liaising with material suppliers to achieve quality, cost and risk management objectives. As a NAND Photolithography Process Development Engineer in the NAND Technology Integration (NTI) at Micron Technology Inc., you will be responsible for rapid deployment of innovative NAND process technologies, drive development efforts prior to device ramp, define & execute effective actions to enable solutions required to hit key milestones & achieve the required performance within timelines. As an Process Development Photolithography Engineer, you will work with Micron engineers, technology partners and vendors to develop and improve unit processes and be part of cross-functional teams. Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following: o Advanced process development tasks such as performing material evaluations, imaging process window analysis, improvements using reticle, layout, OPC improvements & Overlay optimization, in 3D NAND technology. o Troubleshoot processes as part of cross-functional teams driving yield and quality improvement. Be independent and have high initiative to pick up and own areas of improvement. Be comfortable with co-owning areas of improvement with other Fabs and TD teams. o Participate with other Fab photo team peers on technology choices for the upcoming nodes and able to translate future technology device needs into clear process requirements. o Identify disruptive processes early on and work with Fabs to identify viable path forward. o Identify process simplification opportunities and drive cross functional teams in implementation o Incorporate best known manufacturing methods into early development phase of upcoming nodes. Successful candidates for this position will have: o Bachelor/Masters/PhD in Electrical & Electronics, Chemical, Materials Engineering. o Understanding of optics including the principles and application of immersion lithography, polarized illumination. o Experience with chemical process specific to lithography, including materials for 365, 248, and 193nm lithography. o Experience with lithography simulation software and application to low k1 imaging is an added advantage. o Understanding of metrology principles, techniques, challenges and methodologies. o Strong aptitude for technology development and ability to create production-worthy technologies. o Ability to develop and maintain relations with cross-functional teams and vendors. o Strong communication skills (written, verbal and presentation). o Proficient in statistics, data analysis, Design of Experiments (DOE) and comfortable with analysis software tools. o Ability to travel to US TD site for few months to engage in collaborative R&D work.

DBS is on a journey to become a leader in sustainability. We are building a bank that contributes to preserving a healthy planet while also addressing key social needs. To realise this ambition, we are looking for someone enthusiastic about sustainability and about catalysing change. You are someone who questions the status quo, and is not afraid to state your point of view. You are motivated by change for the better, and can pivot projects to accommodate new trends and knowledge. Passionate and updated about the latest sustainability-related trends, news and literature, including the crossroads of technology &digitalisation and sustainability Stakeholder engagement - comfortable with projects with multiple stakeholder from various departments / backgrounds Thoughtful and creative thinker Resourceful and adaptable in uncertainty Able to focus on the goal, while paying attention to details on the journey A strong team player - able to lead initiatives while supporting team members on their projects Strong writing (English) and design skills are a plus Education / Preferred Qualifications A Bachelor's or postgraduate degree in environmental studies, sustainability, business or related field Work Relationship Good relationships with relevant external stakeholders or potential/existing ecosystem partners will be helpful. Job_Descriptions: As a NAND CMOS Process Integration Engineer in the Singapore Technology Development department at Micron Technology Inc., you will be responsible for developing 3D NAND CMOS devices scaling and enhancing their performance, reliability and manufacturability. Extract and analyze inline, probe, parametric, reliability, and other critical metrics and predict future behavior of the CMOS device performance of the product to enable early innovative solutions to meet product and device specifications. Early introduction, characterization and validation of new CMOS device models and test structures for developing future NAND products. 3 dimensions analysis with the use of K2 view to extract layout information and combine with the doping profiles of each implant step for product development and integration solutions. Coordinate activities at manufacturing site towards gating experiment funding, conversions, and effectively communicate decisions made to all R&D, manufacturing, and relevant partners. Assist in the transfer of a new technology from R&D to manufacturing and contribute towards ensuring successful ramp and qualification. Supporting the transfer, documentation and training of module fundamentals into manufacturing.

Hiring_Company: MICRON SEMICONDUCTOR ASIA OPERATIONS PTE. LTD.
Job_Descriptions: Micron’s NAND Technology Integration team is looking for high energy, self-motivated, result driven individuals in the role of process and equipment development engineer to support technology development (TD) activities. The individuals will drive early maturity of process and equipment technologies in Micron’s fast paced environment through engagement with Boise TD, equipment suppliers and manufacturing teams in Singapore. Responsibilities Quantify benefits of innovative equipment solutions to enable early introduction, maturity, and adoption for current and/or next node of 3D NAND RG technology. Partner with Boise TD CVD/PVD development peers on technology choices for the upcoming nodes and able to translate future technology device needs into clear process and equipment requirements. Identify disruptive equipment and processes early, work with manufacturing and Boise TD to identify viable evaluation path forward in manufacturing. Initiate and manage experiments on non-unique and unique equipment for process margin and cost of ownership (CoO) improvements. Design and implement advanced process monitoring and control methodologies. Lead team or sites or suppliers on complex projects in focused meetings with end goal of maturity a technology in record times for technical advantage, cost and productivity. Serve as a technical expert within Micron, provide advice and recommendations to senior management on improvements from equipment development. Lead and initiate innovation projects through patents/technical papers. Communications and collaboration with partners both locally and globally. Strict adherence to Micron Intellectual Property protection policy is a must. Requirements BS, MS, or PhD degree in Materials Science, Chemical/Mechanical Engineering, Chemistry or Physics with minimum of 2 years hands-on experience in leading edge CVD/PVD process area. PhD candidates in semiconductor relevant area are also welcome to apply. A deep understanding of CVD/PVD equipment functionality down to component levels. A good understanding of SMART Equipment Control and Monitoring, Equipment Maturity is preferred A fundamental understanding of chemical kinetics, thermodynamics, physical phenomena and their direct application to CVD/PVD processes. An ability to understand and troubleshoot precursor depletion effects within three dimensional (3D) NAND structures and come up with innovative ideas to mitigate such effects. An understanding of the general process steps and process flow for 3D vNAND memory, CVD/PVD process steps in particular. Excellent skills on design of experiments (DoE), data analysis systems (e.g. JMP) and ability to analyze, conclude and communicate the recommendations in clear and crisp manner. Self-motivated and adaptable to Micron’s fast paced demanding and dynamic work environment; flexibility to work for extended hours, as required. Excellent oral and written communication skills with ability to convey the message clearly and sharply both locally and globally. Excellent ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously; efficiently utilize available resources or seek peers’ and/or management help to get over the roadblocks to drive to solutions. Ability to travel for extended periods of time and stay at Boise TD or at vendor site for 4-6 months at a stretch to learn and develop process or equipment technology development.

Job Summary: Tanglin is seeking to employ a Lead Nurse to oversee and lead its established Nursing Team. The team provides an outstanding level of care for both pupils and staff and is an integral part of supporting the pastoral, physical and mental health and wellbeing of students throughout their Tanglin journey. We are looking for a dynamic, caring leader who believes children and young people are at the centre of any care we provide. The successful applicant will lead the Nursing Team; managing the Health Centres and overseeing the medical care provided. They will work collaboratively with other teams across the school to ensure the highest levels of wellbeing in the Tanglin community. They will be an advisor to the management team on health risk and management of health-related incidents. They will also be a member of Coordinating Wellbeing Services (CWS) collaborating with Head of Counselling and Educational Psychologist to promote wellbeing across the school. The role reports to the Director of Pastoral Care. Requirements: Register Nurse qualification Registered with Singapore Nursing Board Minimum 5 years of relevant working experience with proven experience in similar role Experience working in a school environment an advantage Strong leadership, people management and team building skills Good command of written and spoken English Familiar with caring for school aged children, knowledge of wellness and health education programmes an advantage PC literate (MS Excel and Word) Possess high degree of discretion, diplomacy and tact in discharging duties Organised, meticulous and possesses strong co-ordination skills Pleasant personality with excellent interpersonal and communication skills Ability to work independently as well as a good team player with good initiative Be willing and able to accompany students of all ages on residential school trips Key Responsibilities 1. Leading the Nursing Team To ensure all nurses (including supply staff) work as an informed, proactive, effective and cohesive unit with the health and safety of all the students and staff being paramount. To lead a team of professional Nurses, promoting professional development of nursing staff, both clinically and theoretically, by liaising with relevant agencies on delivery of appropriate courses. Identify knowledge gaps and plan CPD actively to address these needs, ensuring appropriate updates for First Aid, Basic Life Support and AED, Epipen Skills for all Nursing Staff. To ensure accurate recording and evaluation of training, update HR on qualifications gained. To liaise with HR on staff recruitment, developing a robust Induction programme, mentorship, training and development of all nursing staff. Ensuring staffing levels in all health centres are adequate at all times and, when necessary, arrange for supply cover. Complete the Review and Development process for all nursing staff, supporting development opportunities based on a reflective coaching method. Maintain an accurate record of all Professional Development opportunities. To initiate and lead effective team working, through regular discussions, meetings and open mutual feedback. To liaise with International School Nurses across Singapore, supporting, facilitating and sharing of professional development. To liaise with International SOS, outdoor education boards and International School Nursing Association, attending and participating as requested in conferences, writing of papers etc. 2. Managing the Health Centres and Overseeing the Medical Provision To provide and manage emergency medical care across the school for students and visitors. To adhere to the Singapore Nursing Board Code of Professional Conduct. Demonstrate professional conduct, preserve clients’ rights including confidentiality and promote mutual respect amongst colleagues. To exhibit expert skills in clinical school nursing and leadership, facilitating and supporting colleagues to provide best practice and safe clinical care. To act as an advocate, providing supportive care for students who require mental health support; liaising with families, internal multidisciplinary team alongside external agencies with the child or young person as a primary focus. To identify and recommend innovations and service changes in practice within the Health Centre and Staff Doctors Clinic and be responsible for leading and establishing change. To ensure all health-related school policies are current and compliant with clinical and school requirements adhering to national policies where required. To research, develop, implement and support best practice health promotion programmes for students and staff across the school, i.e. Mammobus, Blood drive, Pandemic Preparedness Creating and implementing the team’s annual Development Plan in line with the school’s strategic plan and review throughout the academic year. To liaise with Applications to ensure student and staff clinic databases are secure and documentation meets appropriate data protection regulations. Maintain safe nurse staffing level for the staff doctor’s clinic ensuring a relevant clinical skill base for all staff working within the clinic. To meet the Ministry of Health regulations on the licensing of the School Medical Clinic. Liaise with HR to ensure clinic meets safety guidelines. To manage a delegated Nursing budget within a whole school budget. 3. Wider School Roles To represent the Nursing Team as a member of Continuing Wellbeing Services (CWS); researching, developing and leading innovative approaches to mental and physical wellbeing across the school, encompassing staff and students. To collaborate with Heads of Pastoral/ Heads of PSHCE/Life Skills on curriculum and pastoral needs pertaining to health care and healthy living by researching, developing and delivering specialist input. To be a member of Staff Wellbeing Committee, highlight concerns, discuss solutions to support staff across school with their own emotional and social wellbeing. To be a member of pastoral and vulnerable student’s teams, liaising with counsellors, education psychologist, learning support and Heads of Pastoral, to provide support to students with a health and wellbeing perspective. Attend and participate in meetings across the three schools providing advice as required (i.e., vulnerable students meeting, Heads of Year meetings) To act as a support and advocate for staff and student’s journeys through chronic and serious illness, researching and signposting to relevant external agencies as required. To liaise directly with Outdoor education regarding sufficient nursing cover for residential and identified Singapore field study trips, based on school policy alongside individual trip risk assessments. Liaise with Outdoor Education and trip service providers to develop risk assessments for specific students with medical requirements ensuring inclusivity and safety is adhered to. To liaise with Sports and Activities in providing appropriate nursing support for sporting events and advising of other supporting agencies (i.e. ambulance, physiotherapist). To support and advise on First Aid training curriculum within school for staff and students. To research, develop health related talks as part of Parent Wise to staff and parents when required. 4. Crisis Management and Communication Liaising with Management team on any school wide health related matters, either student or staff issues. i.e., Eating Disorders, Hand Foot and Mouth Disease, Haze, wellbeing, COVID. To be proactive in communicating to the TTS community, relevant, up to date health information, liaising with the TTS communications department where appropriate. (e.g. Pandemic). Advising Heads of School on prevalent community, country or regional wide health issues and preparing prevention /educational strategies for school community. Develop and evaluate school-wide accident reporting system. Monitor accidents across the school and feedback statistics as required to the leadership team. To be a member of the Crisis Management Team, to be called upon to report to CEO and Management on emergency and health related issues affecting staff and the wider school community. To liaise with Leadership team and Ministry of Health to respond to a pandemic threat to the Tanglin community, initiating and managing Temperature Testing procedures and following the School Pandemic Plan. To review TTS pandemic plan regularly, maintaining pandemic stock (i.e., N95 masks, hand sanitizer, communication documents). To liaise with relevant Singapore authorities (i.e., Ministry of Health, Ministry of Education), informing them of notifiable infectious disease clusters within Tanglin Trust School and adhering to any advice given. Report all Ministry of Health advice to the Senior Management Team. To liaise with Housekeeping and Operations departments in maintaining clean safe environment within each school and informing them of infectious disease outbreaks so hygiene precautions can be elevated. Be responsible for reporting any concerns about a child to the Designated Safeguarding Lead. Embrace the School’s commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive environment. The school is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of its students and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment. We will conduct thorough background checks on all successful applicants. 5-day week with school holidays entitlement. For more information, visit www.ifc.org The Treasury Client Solutions department is responsible for structuring and executing transactions that provide IFC's clients with innovative treasury solutions, including local currency financing, derivative and risk mitigation products, debt capital markets and structured finance solutions. The Treasury Client Solutions department takes pride in contributing to innovative transactions across emerging markets across providing solutions to IFC's clients. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a truly multicultural environment and contribute to an area of strategic priority for IFC, applying a wide range of fixed income instruments to provide innovative solutions for IFC's clients, and join in IFC's mission to create opportunity and improve people's lives. The position is with the Treasury Client Solutions' unit that focuses on Asia and the Pacific region and it will be located in Singapore. Duties and Accountabilities: Contribute to day-to-day business delivery across CTC products, programs and markets by developing, structuring and facilitating execution of fixed income and structured finance transactions for IFC's clients as a member of local currency coverage and project teams. Contribute to business development, and explain treasury products to clients, regulators, and banks; Contribute to the team's strong relationships with key stakeholders, including investment banks, local banks, capital markets firms, development finance institutions, and regulators; Contribute to IFC's transition to new risk-free rates, providing internal trainings within IFC and support its clients in the process; Apply financial models to structure, evaluate, and price transactions; and c6NDmwG 7FHWn Provide training and knowledge management services to colleagues and external clients. Selection Criteria MBA/Masters (or equivalent) in Finance, Economics, Business, Engineering, Mathematics, Law or related area; 5-10 years of relevant experience in finance, with the focus on debt capital markets, derivatives and/or structured finance; Sound understanding of fixed income instruments (including derivatives and foreign exchange) combined with strong analytical skills, problem solving capability and financial modeling skills; Demonstrated ability to structure and analyze various fixed income instruments for corporate clients (including local currency loans, derivatives, bond and/or structured finance). Solid understanding of asset-and-liability management is a plus; Strong interpersonal skills, ability to work in teams, attention to detail and resourcefulness; Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English Unequivocal commitment to diversity and inclusion. Job_Descriptions: You will be responsible for leading a team of engineers to define NAND flash wafer level reliability test flow to assess the product reliability performance of leading-edge 3D NAND memory products. you will be responsible for driving an effort to accelerate NAND development learning cycles to achieve best in class cycle time from first silicon to qualified system. Additionally, you will work with various Engineering and Development groups to ensure necessary actions are taken to meet NAND reliability (Material Assessment Flow) product requirements. You will be engaged in developing, validating, characterizing, and qualifying Micron’s next generation 3D NAND memory products to power our customers’ innovation. Job Summary: - You will be responsible for leading a team of engineers to define NAND flash wafer level reliability test flow to assess the product reliability performance of leading-edge 3D NAND memory products. you will be responsible for driving an effort to accelerate NAND development learning cycles to achieve best in class cycle time from first silicon to qualified system. Additionally, you will work with various Engineering and Development groups to ensure necessary actions are taken to meet NAND reliability (Material Assessment Flow) product requirements. You will be engaged in developing, validating, characterizing, and qualifying Micron’s next generation 3D NAND memory products to power our customers’ innovation. Roles & Responsibilities Define NAND flash reliability test flow to assess the product reliability performance and ensure no intrinsic reliability issues escape to customer. Direct all technical aspects for the team, communicate ideas clearly and develop effective technical strategies for the success of the product. Manage team performance and conduct regular performance appraisal with team members. Position requires extensive interface and partnership with Technology Development, Process Integration, Design, Reliability, and Manufacturing groups. Requirement: 10+ years’ experience in semiconductor industry with 3+ years of management experience. Good problem solving and analytical skills. Able to make decision in complex situations. Strong knowledge in semiconductor device physics, especially in nonvolatile memories product and reliability is a must Experienced in reliability failure statistics physics or failure mechanisms Experienced in flash memory product development. Experience in 3D NAND flash /3D NAND Process Knowledge will be a plus. Self-motivated and strong ability in driving solutions through working with different teams. Good communication and project management skills.

Job_Title: Learning Design, Technology and Analytics , L&D, Group Human Resources
Job_Descriptions: Learning Design, Technology and Analytics , L&D, Group Human Resources Job Brief: You will play a key role in a team that champions and enables the vision of an empowered learning culture by leveraging both human-centred learning design principles, technologies and insights from learning data. The ideal person possesses good knowledge of current learning theories and design principles, coupled with strong expertise and experience in designing, implementing, evaluating, and optimising technology- enhanced learning innovations and programmes. S/he is a creative problem-solver who is excited about the possibility of creating impactful end-to-end technology-enriched learning experiences and outcomes for employees groupwide that deliver on the organisation's goals. Responsibilities: Play a key role in designing, deploying and continuously improving technology-enhanced learning innovations that deliver meaningful and impactful learning experiences to employees across OCBC Group. This includes: Identifying, leading, and executing initiatives that support the OCBC Campus vision of building an evidence-informed learning organisation, through strategic partnerships and research collaboration with internal and external stakeholders, aimed at building a knowledge base of empirical insights that further drive the transformation of OCBC into a strong learning organisation. Ongoing optimisation of a cloud-based learning management system, including the drive towards more seamless and integrated phygital learning experiences for employees across multiple learning apps/platforms-both internal and external. Collaborate with L&D Faculty and Business Subject Matter Experts to design, create and continually improve on e-learning content and modalities in line with pedagogical best practices. Collaborate with cross-functional and cross-divisional teams (incl. Campus Operations, IT, SME project teams) to design and implement initiatives that sets OCBC Campus apart as a leading technology- enhanced learning space/environment. Collaborate with Learning Business Partners and Business Lines to provide data-led learning insights and recommend actions to support organizational learning strategies. Play a critical role in the design, implementation and ongoing refinement of learning/programme evaluation mechanisms to track and demonstrate learning gains at individual and organisational levels. Contribute significantly to the integrity, quality and use of learning data generated on the learning management system and other data sources, for the purpose of advancing the L&D vision. This includes working with HR analytics to design, develop and deploy a Learning Organisation dashboard that informs executive decision-making. Develop strong knowledge of key products and services offered by the organisation as well as relevant regulatory frameworks governing this industry. Contribute positively to a vibrant, passionate, open-minded, and creative working team culture. *LI-SS Qualifications Required: A Bachelor's and/or postgraduate degree in learning sciences domain preferred. Passion and experience in technology and its application to learning and development. Experience with cloud-based learning management systems, and specifically Cornerstone OnDemand would be an advantage. Deep interest, strong technical and analytical skills to mine, draw insights, and visualise learning data in compelling ways that inform key executive decision-making. Experience in learning analytics and visualisations would be an advantage. Capable of both strategic thinking and detailed operationalisation of projects and tasks. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to drive for results with different stakeholder groups including IT.

Site Reliability Engineers (Development) Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is an engineering discipline that combines software and systems engineering to build and run large-scale, massively distributed, fault-tolerant systems. SRE is responsible for the availability and reliability of our firm's most critical platform services, and ensures they meet the requirements of our internal and external users. We look for engineers who are motivated to collaborate with our businesses to build and run sustainable production systems, which can evolve and adapt to changes in our fast-paced, global business environment. The Position: Direct exposure to best-in-class Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team, disciplines and tooling Adhere to and drive incident management process and support a blameless post-mortems culture. Develop, support, improve & administer the Firm's primary business-critical trading infrastructure Create and support automation tooling to improve the reliability of the platform and to increase the productivity of the team. Provide critical day-to-day support for a massive scale, distributed system Assess monitoring & alert signals to determine impact and risk to the business and contribute to the incident management process The successful candidate will have outstanding verbal and written communications, a natural ability to learn in a fast-paced environment, and will be a self-starter with plenty of initiative. The Candidate: Proficient in at least one programming language Ability to handle multiple on-going assignments and be able to work independently in addition to contributing as part of a highly collaborative and globally dispersed team Strong analytical skills with the ability to break down and communicate complex issues, ideas and solutions Willingness to learn new languages and programming paradigms (functional programming for example) Previous experience in a blameless SRE environment would be a plus Previous Linux exposure or willingness to learn Good to have Degree in computer science or engineering, or equivalent industry experience Works effectively and thrives in a team while able to operate independently, self-motivation is essential Strong verbal and written communication skills For more information you can email Ganjapan Chamsaeng in our Singapore office on ganjapan.chamsaeng@teksystems.com quoting Job Reference 524085 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest. http://jobs.en-sg.teksystems.com/wCeZIC/site-reliability-engineers-development-itcommunications-singapore-singapore-14806492 Allegis Group Singapore Pte Ltd, Company Reg No. 200909448N, EA License No. 10C4544

Learning Technology, Analytics and Design , L&D, Group Human Resources - (210001WW) Job Brief: You will play a key role in a team that champions and enables the vision of an empowered learning culture by leveraging both learning technology and insights from learning data. The ideal person possesses a good knowledge of current learning technologies and analytics  practices and platforms, with strong expertise and experience in designing, implementing, evaluating and optimising technology-enhanced learning innovations and programmes. S/he is a creative problem-solver who is excited about the possibility of creating impactful technology-enriched learning experiences and outcomes for employees groupwide that deliver on the organisation’s goals. Responsible for the integrity, quality and use of learning data generated on the learning management system and other data sources, for the purpose of advancing the L&D vision. Develop strong knowledge of key products and services offered by the organisation as well as relevant regulatory frameworks governing this industry. Contribute positively to a vibrant, passionate, open-minded, and creative working team culture.

Ensure that all spare parts are available for use whenever required and proper storage of supplies & materials. Maintain fire-fighting facilities and equipment in compliance to the Fire Safety regulation. Perform regular energy/ defect analysis and be involved in energy management. Your experience and skills include: Experience in the relevant field is preferred. Passionate, energetic and self‐motivated individual who can deliver exceptional performance. Bitcoin.com's mission is to create more 'economic freedom' in the world. By economic freedom we mean the ability for individuals to freely acquire and use personal resources however they choose. We assert that economic freedom is a fundamental human right and a vital component of human dignity, and we believe that it is foundational for peaceful and prosperous societies. Our vision is to provide the next billion people with access to products that exemplify the ideals of Bitcoin. These ideals - which include peer-to-peer transactions, decentralization, censorship resistance, and permissionless-ness - support economic freedom. Our approach is to develop and promote widely accessible products that support economic freedom. For example, our digital wallet - which has 27 million downloads - provides people with an easy-to-use, non-custodial method for buying, selling, storing, sending, receiving, and trading cryptocurrencies. We are seeking a talented Talent Acquisition Specialist for Bitcoin.com who shares our vision. In this role, you focus on sourcing and recruiting global top talent to join Bitcoin.com. You will work closely with all departments and the hiring teams to ensure a streamlined hiring process. As we are a growing company you will also work on developing standardized processes that can scale. A large portion of our hiring needs are in the tech space - so experience with recruiting developers will be a plus! This is an unrivalled opportunity to work with a team of highly skilled product managers, developers, designers, and marketers to build a cryptocurrency platform comprised of many integrations and applications that will change the ecosystem trajectory and lead to mass adoption of Bitcoin and Bitcoin Cash. What you'll be doing: Coordinate with hiring managers to develop the best approach for all new roles Work with hiring managers to determine selection criteria Source potential candidates through various online channels (AngelList, LinkedIn etc.) Conduct screening calls, assessments and interviews Assess candidate information, including resumes and contact details, using our Applicant Tracking System (We are currently using Workable) Coordinate with Hiring Managers to design job descriptions and interview questions that reflect each position’s requirements Maintain our internal database Foster long-term relationships with past applicants and potential candidates Work with HRBP to align hiring strategies on a short, mid, long term basis Requirements What you'll be bringing: Experience with end to end recruitment Proven work experience as a Talent Acquisition Specialist (Both external & internal preferred) Familiarity with social media, resume databases and professional networks (e.g. Stack Overflow and Github) Hands-on experience with full-cycle recruiting using various interview techniques and evaluation methods Knowledge of Applicant Tracking Systems (ATSs) Excellent English verbal and written communication skills A keen understanding of the differences between various roles within organizations Experience with tech hiring An interest in Cryptocurrencies Benefits We are serious about what we do, but more importantly, we have a lot of fun doing it. Our work culture is modern, meaning we strive for work experiences based on transparency, productivity, trust, and passion. For all benefits include: Flexible work hours Remote work Health insurance reimbursement Wellness program (gym, etc.) Salary paid in Cryptocurrency

Job_Title: Regional Sales Manager, Small Business Group
Job_Descriptions: Meta's Small Business Group is looking for a Regional Sales Manager. The Small Business Group (SBG) contributes directly to this mission by connecting every small business in the world with their customers on Facebook, Instagram, and Messenger, and then helping them grow through solutions like pages, advertising, and messaging. We succeed when we help our customers grow their businesses. The Small Business Group at Meta is one of two sales channels responsible for Meta’s multi-billion dollar advertising business. Our team helps more than 99% of Meta’s 10 million plus advertisers. Our potential business is even larger with more than 200 million businesses using our tools to connect with customers. The position will be responsible for developing and managing chat and sales programs to help clients get the best results from their marketing campaigns on Meta – through consultation, education, optimization, and support via vendor partners. In addition to developing a high-performing operation, this position will be responsible for working with other teams across Meta to create and grow programs focused on improving the Meta experience for our clients. Ideal candidates will combine an exceptional ability to drive results through vendor partners; a passion for delivering value to clients through rigorous planning and flawless execution; a keen eye for identifying process and workflow opportunities; and a willingness to roll up their sleeves and execute the tactics. Success in this position requires strong sales, vendor management, and problem-solving skills; attention to detail; the ability to thrive in a dynamic and changing environment; and a passion for helping others achieve results. This position is a full time role located in our Singapore office. At Meta, we are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workplace. Our SBG team is focused on amplifying diverse perspectives across our community, so we welcome you, your personal experience and different perspectives. Design and lead regional sales programs via vendor partners Develop and implement strategy for scaling chat programs to fuel the growth of Small Businesses Deliver against quarter targets in revenue, product adoption and customer satisfaction Monitor progress against goals and manage vendors to meet and exceed operational and productivity metrics Make data-informed decisions to drive performance, resource allocation and juggle competing priorities Become an expert in Meta’s solutions for businesses of all sizes Work effectively in highly collaborative environment Identify actionable insights to improve client results and team strategy — in APAC and globally Identify opportunities to improve ad products and the customer experience and influence action BA/BS degree 6+ years experience working with sales, digital marketing, advertising or program management Strong collaboration, communication and influencing skills with prior experience working across regional and global partners Analytical thinker with knowledge in data concepts and principles Self-motivated, entrepreneurial, and experience dealing with ambiguity Critical-thinking and problem-solving experience Experience prioritizing and focusing on driving growth Detail-oriented and organized skills Preferred experience working and building relationships with outsourced vendors/third parties, or with Small and Medium Businesses, external sales and marketing partners, or Advertising Agencies Experience managing scaled chat programs and workflows COPC certification or experience working with outsourced sales vendors Fluency in regional language(s) is an asset in order to partner manage in specific markets where languages are required. Your browser doesn't support mapbox-gl library. To see the map, turn on WebGL in your browser settings and try again. Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Job_Title: VP, Regional Business Development, Private Bank
Job_Descriptions: About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Retail function provides Personal and Business Banking customers with financial solutions tailored to their needs. We help them manage their money wisely and meet their financial goals through an extensive range of products and services. These include deposit, insurance, secured and unsecured loans, investment and wealth advisory services. Personal Financial Services We design and provide products and services that empower our customers to enjoy greater banking convenience while they extract more value from their money. In particular, we are focused on promoting and developing healthy saving and investment practices across generations. Job Responsibilities We are seeking for a Regional Business Development Manager (BDM) to support Private Bank's (PB) regional expansion and outreach efforts in target markets within Asia. The BDM is responsible to embed PB's value proposition and be the regional acquisition lead to identify new business opportunities. The BDM will be involved in strategic and tactical planning and positioning of PB value proposition and is the 'go-to' person for all PB related matters for internal and external stakeholders. Specific Responsibilities Responsible to drive new business development activities and to create business and sales marketing plan for countries of coverage to achieve business objectives. Perform market research and benchmarking, plan prospecting activities and establish referral SOPs. Manage key stakeholders in markets and deepen relationships with potential clients and internal stakeholders. Create and maintain acquisition pipelines and contact plan for each prospect. Perform acquisition forecast and analysis of leads pipelines in accordance to requirement. Plan regular engagement sessions to train / update in-country teams on PB updates and upskill them with required knowledge to facilitate flow of business to PB. Work with Group Marketing to raise PB brand awareness in markets of coverage by rolling out curated and targeted activities that are fit for purpose. Take charge of all BD activities rollout, eDMs and collaterals, tracking of post activities ROIs and feedback. Job Requirements Who are we looking for? Resourceful self-starter with strong interpersonal and networking skills. An advocate for work efficiency to make things simpler, faster and better. Ability to work independently, prioritise workload and execute in accordance to plan. Strategic thinker and able to see the bigger picture in order to improve the business. Analytical mindset to structure business plans and tenacity to overcome challenges. Exceptional oral and written communication skills to articulate clearly. Willingness to travel (20% of time). Education / Experience Requirements A successful candidate must possess a Bachelor's degree in finance, marketing, business management or any business-related fields. A least 5 years of business development experience within high net worth sales / acquisition space and experience in planning and execution of marketing plans. Experience working in a Private Banking environment preferred. Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

Job_Title: Vice President, Business Manager, Enterprise Banking, Group Commercial Banking
Job_Descriptions: About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Wholesale Bank function operates a dynamic business model that provides financial services and solutions to help our clients achieve their strategic business objectives. Our mission is to become the premier-provider of banking services and solutions for Asia-based commercial banking companies (small medium enterprises), large corporations, financial institutions as well as multinational corporations. Our coverage teams work in full alignment with specialised teams across Transaction Banking, Investment Banking, Global Markets and Group Retail to deliver seamless solutions to our clients. Job Responsibilities Acquire new accounts / manage existing accounts to achieve profitability targets established Be involved in the sales and marketing of a wide spectrum of banking products and services to meet the financial and investment needs of Small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) enterprises Cross-sell products and services to generate revenue growth for the department Job Requirements A recognised degree in Accountancy, Business Administration or Banking and Finance Minimum 5 years of credit and marketing experience in handling local SME businesses Excellent business acumen and the ability to deliver targets Proven track records in developing SME business Strong interpersonal and communication skills A highly-motivated self-starter Strong analytical skills Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

Enterprise Architecture (EA) Governance plays a vital role in the organisation to manage and enforce Technology Architecture Standards and Direction as well as ensuring alignment between the Technology and Business strategies. It harmonises the architectural requirements into a comprehensive set of Architecture Directions, Guiding Principles, Guidelines and Directions of Use for the various parties to follow in solution proposal and project implementations. As the Lead of the Enterprise Architecture Team, he/she is expected to possess the following attributes: Positive attitude and is resilient when dealing with challenges. Excellent leadership skills to motivate and develop the team members. Excellent communication skills to clearly and effectively articulate technical concepts, solutions, recommendations, etc. Ability to work independently and being a self-starter. Vast industry knowledge and experience in defining and governing Enterprise Technology Architecture. Strong technical knowledge and analytical mind to propose sound and practical solutions to resolve Technology Architecture problems. Ability to establish close collaborations with stakeholders across Business and IT communities which include Technical Leads, Project Managers, Scrum Masters, Business Analysts, etc. Keen mindset for improvements of day-to-day operation Responsibilities Lead the Enterprise Architecture Team to uphold and uplift the governance standards and coverage of Technology Architecture in OCBC Group. Chair solution and project reviews for entities within OCBC Group to ensure the proposed solutions and project implementations adhere to the Technology Architecture Standard. Define and enhance Technology Architecture Standards, Architecture Directions, Guiding Principles, Directions of Use, etc. Govern the management of obsolescence of applications and technologies within OCBC Group to meet the defined KRI indicators. Enforce standardisation of platforms, technologies, frameworks and processes within OCBC Group. Explore and evaluate new technologies to enhance the Technology Architecture recommendations to support future needs of OCBC Group. Review and approve design proposals and Technology Architecture recommendations to ensure alignment with the Technology Architecture Standards and Direction. Qualifications Degree in a related IT discipline. 20 years or more IT solution delivery experience with at least 10 years in a similar role to manage the Enterprise Architecture governance and with excellent track record. Possess leadership skills that inspire others and embrace teanwork and collaboration. Extensive people and team management experience, including strong coaching skills to develop team members for greater heights. Possession of Financial Technology experience. Significant experience in successfully led large cross-functional teams or enterprise projects will be added advantage.

Project Manager (Cash Management) The Purpose: This role is to manage Cash Management IT projects (Site initiatives with Regional application/IT impact as well as Regional application releases). This role is essential a leadership role to manage the various components (TBA, Operations, IT, TCOE, Compliance, IT Security, Stakeholders, etc) that forms the project team/scope and timely reporting (progress status and mandays/financials) and escalations to Management is essential to flag critical dependencies, risks and issues for an executive decision that will align the delivery plan back on track. The responsibilities: Deliver IT projects/releases within the agreed budget and schedule without compromising quality. Be knowledgeable functionally and drive projects from initiation to post implementation support following SDLC/Agile and QMS methodologies. Enforce the Bank's project management policies and procedures. Set expectation and project governance at kick off and monitor adherence/compliance throughout the project phases. Lead the (Core and Extended) Teams together and collaborate closely to deliver the project/release. Ensure delivery plans, objectives and targets are aligned clearly with the teams and stakeholders. Collate progress statuses to track/align reality with delivery plan and publish the reports to stakeholders. Manage project Dependencies, Risks and Issues with the project teams to overcome challenges or propose mitigation plans if require escalations to Management for decisions. Chair Steercos to provide communication and status reporting to stakeholders and senior management. Job Category Products and Technology Job Details Salesforce is searching for an entry network engineer to join Salesforce's Network Trust Operations (NTO) team—the team responsible for maintaining software/firmware security compliance for network equipment deployed across Salesforce first-party data centers. As an NTO engineer, you'll tackle the responsibility to ensure that software/firmware deployed across Salesforce first-party data centers is patched to the most secure version available to maintain security compliance. You will also be working on creating and modifying procedures that will be applied to perform the software/firmware upgrade tasks, while maintaining the highest possible network uptime. Responsibilities Ensure documented processes are followed while providing vital feedback focussed on safety and agility of the processes involved. Perform high-level troubleshooting and analysis to resolve root cause when network outages occur during software/firmware upgrades. Isolate hardware and software problems on network devices and work with vendors to resolve issues as necessary. Perform proactive network audits to help strategize software/firmware rollouts across the entire fleet. Work collaboratively with engineering teams to identify ways in which we can proactively improve the stability of the network and decrease potential for future outages. Required Skills Experience with managing computer networks Basic proficiency in UNIX and TCP/IP network fundamentals Knowledge of routing protocols such as BGP, and ISIS Experience coding in at least one language Ability to learn new development languages (Python and GO) Ability to pick up new concepts around network design and management Ability to communicate cross-functionally Preferred Qualifications Knowledge of working on multi vendor networks Knowledge of Load Balancing #LI-Y Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form. Data Risk Analyst - Digital Bank We're looking for a Data Risk Analyst to work onsite within our Digital Bank. We're a small, but growing venture, with new and exciting problems to solve. We work in project-based sprints in small, interdisciplinary teams. The successful candidate will report to the Data Risk Lead and assist the Head of Audit in the development and execution of the Data Analytics Strategy and Roadmap for the use of analytics for the audit team. The goal is to eventually transform the full audit team to be successfully using deep analytics for the audits. You are highly analytical, experienced in data analytics, preferably with Retail Consumer and Technology domain knowledge. You are comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with high degree of ambiguity, enjoys solving complex problems and focused to get things done. The candidate we are looking for, are eager to develop multi-disciplinary skillsets which this role offers great opportunities for candidates to lead audits and cross over to other domains. As a digital bank and growing venture, the role offers rare opportunity to partner across all business units to define innovative and automated audit approaches. This is a unique, challenging opportunity to be part of an end-to-end process to build a strong audit function within the new virtual bank. The Role Responsibility: • Contribute to promote collaboration and strong culture across business units to address risk and control issues. • Support the implementation of the data strategy and roadmap for the audit function. • Support the drive of a multidisciplinary audit team to use data analytics in audits and ongoing monitoring. • Support and work with audit, technology and data teams to leverage/develop processes, tools and capabilities for audit use cases. • Support the use of predictive modelling to identify emerging risks or control issues. • Develop risk and control dashboards and automated monitoring on risks and controls. • Perform and support where directed, the planning, fieldwork, and reporting of internal audit engagements to deliver agreed assurance objectives to established standards and timelines. • Maintain effective relationships with internal stakeholders to provide input / assistance on developing their audit approach as required. • Provide non-assurance services to business units where required, through active participation on advisory engagements / special projects within the Bank. • Share knowledge, skills and experience with team members to guide and assist in their development. Our Ideal Candidate: • Enjoys working in a dynamic environment, is passionate about risk, data and technology and can focus on key issues and the details that come with it. • Team player with the ability to collaborate with stakeholders to develop use cases • 6 years' work experience in data analytics, models and data visualisation. • Technical skills in tools such as Domo, Tableau, Google, Analytics, Python, SQL, Spark, R, etc. • Prior audit, Retail Consumer and/or technology experience will be added advantage. • Experience with cloud technologies (AWS, S3, Lambda, Sagemaker, EC2, etc) • Experience in Agile ways of working and familiarity with tools like Jira, Confluence, Trello, Slack etc. • Demonstrates ability to work independently and seek guidance when needed. • Demonstrates ability to multi-task without loss of quality. • Flexibility to work across different functions and situations, and change priorities at short notice. • Demonstrates ability to think critically, objectively and "think outside the box" when analyzing issues and recommending / developing solutions. • Effective written, verbal and presentation communication skills. • Demonstrates understanding of and commitment to the Bank's core values.

Job_Title: Growth Strategist, Product Marketing, Growth Lab - Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree in marketing or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience in marketing, driving user acquisition, engagement, retention, and go-to-market strategy. Preferred qualifications: Experience with Growth Marketing through email marketing, notifications, in-app promo, SMS, messaging. Experience collaborating cross-functionally across product, marketing, and engineering teams. Experience with data, metrics, and experimentation. Ability to effectively influence and communicate across all levels of management and work on multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment. Excellent problem-solving, project management skills, with good business judgment and the ability to back your points of view with data. About the job Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end. The Growth Lab team is a fast growing team with high-executive visibility and the opportunity to work across functions and global product areas at Google. Our goal is to spread Google brand love and get more users to use more Google products, more often and on more devices. We provide insights, best practices, tools, and services to help product and marketing teams achieve that. You’ll join a team of experienced growth marketers and collaborate with product and marketing teams to help them drive their Growth objectives using Google’s Owned and Operated digital assets, including Google sites, apps, and databases. This is a fast paced, highly collaborative team that involves numerous stakeholders. Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself. Resposibilities Develop the APAC Growth strategy, in line with APAC Marketing Priorities: grow product adoption and retention, deliver critical information to millions of users, and drive brand sentiment. Collaborate with the Growth/Notifications Engineering team and APAC marketing teams to shape the future of Growth Marketing, align on vision and resources, and run critical pilots. Execute the Growth marketing plans: testing, learnings and scaling, and work with our pool of analysts to develop lower funnel measurement plans. Be a thought leader for Growth Marketing at Google, driving best practices across Google’s product and country teams, and help set internal and industry standards.

Job_Title: Brand and Reputation Product Marketing Manager, Policy Marketing
Job_Descriptions: Minimum qualifications: 5 years of experience in brand reputation/policy marketing or communications in multinational company, government organization, strategy consulting, or related field Experience working in Public Policy matters, social impact initiatives or purpose-driven brands Experience in project and campaign management, and creating plans from scratch Preferred qualifications: Master's degree with experience in consulting, investment banking, or related field Experience conducting research and managing relationships with research agencies, finding creative ways to run initiatives and campaigns Experience working in complex organizations with multiple executive stakeholders Understanding of Google's products, programs and the wider Technology industry Tolerance for ambiguity and ability to work in a fast-changing, highly cross-functional environment, while maintaining an entrepreneurial approach Strong problem solving skills with ability to build business insights and recommendations to effectively balance long-term strategic thinking with near-term execution About the job Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end. The Brand and Reputation Marketing team is tasked with demonstrating Google’s contribution to the societies and economies of the countries where we operate. The team’s focus areas are proving Google’s helpfulness in driving economic growth and showing Google’s digital responsibility in areas such as privacy, security, and online safety. In the first area, through online and in-person courses, we strive to help women, SMB owners, individuals, and developers gain new skills to advance their careers and/or make their businesses more successful. When it comes to digital responsibility, we educate users about how to take control of their data, how to be vigilant online, and how we are committed to helping them along the way. Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself. Resposibilities Own APAC policy marketing strategy, defining priority areas and key interventions for APAC. Partner with relevant stakeholders cross-functionally to appropriately prioritize and execute Develop a deep and ongoing understanding of policymakers in APAC, collaborating with market insights and other cross-functional stakeholders globally and in APAC Own campaign management for policy marketing adjacent topics Develop tactics and marketing campaigns to effectively deliver Google's product innovation and contribution story to key opinion formers, policymakers and consumers in APAC. Support internal communications and operations Create legislation-specific messaging campaigns and creative assets for key markets that are based on learnings and insights from message testing

Job_Title: Sales Consultant, Music, Large Customer Sales
Job_Descriptions: Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience in a customer-facing role working with digital and online advertising products and solutions. Experience in the music industry or in digital media. Preferred qualifications: Experience working on complex projects involving marketing metrics, consulting, big data or media. Knowledge of and passion for Google’s product suite of video ad solutions (with a strong focus on YouTube). Ability to work autonomously with experience in reporting remotely to manager. Effective presentation and data visualization skills. Effective relationship and project management skills, with the ability to oversee multiple, simultaneous solutions, supported by internal teams. About the job Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users. As a Sales Consultant, you will be on the Sales team that is helping music labels to promote artists through Google and YouTube advertising. Job_Title: Lead, Brand Planning and Measurement, Go-To-Market
Job_Descriptions: Minimum qualifications: 5 years of experience in brand media planning and measurement or sales strategy or product marketing Experience in Google/YouTube brand planning and measurement products Project management experience and experience in managing projects with executive stakeholders across multiple organizations Preferred qualifications: Ability to take initiative and manage multiple projects from inception to completion Aptitude for strategic long-term thinking and ability to translate vision into achievable quarterly milestones Excellent communication skills, ability to influence executive stakeholders and build relationships with cross-functional partners Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to build persuasive and data driven business cases About the job The Product Go-to-Market (GTM) team helps ensure that Google's complex and ever-evolving Ads business runs smoothly. We are instrumental in setting the go-to-market strategy for ad products across a range of Google Ad Product areas. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, while also helping to evolve early stage products or strategic ideas into future-growth initiatives. Team members are passionate about product, analytical and strategic with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done. The APAC Display and Video Product GTM team leads the video and display ads strategy, product commercialization and activation efforts across all APAC markets. The team is charged with developing and deploying the strategy that takes our video and display ads business to greater heights and beyond. As a Lead, you will own and drive Google’s APAC priorities on first party brand planning and measurement products. In this role, you will work closely with global product teams (Global Product Leads, Product Managers, Engineering), regional and in-market teams (Sales Specialists, gTech, Marketing, etc.) and external teams (Agencies, etc.) to commercialize (launch, deploy, activate) products and solutions that enable our sales teams to help customers achieve their marketing objectives. You will be expected to take ownership, prioritize, and navigate ambiguity to execute effectively. You will lead without authority and build persuasive and data driven business cases that influence a wide range of stakeholders across functions. Resposibilities Lead commercialization and shape roadmap of Google’s first party brand planning and measurement products including Reach Planning and Reporting, Brand Lift, Search Lift, View-ability and Brand Safety Measurement across APAC markets. Be a subject matter expert on brand planning and measurement solutions. Advise markets on how to uniquely adapt product value propositions to market/sector nuances. Identify key product needs across APAC and partner with Product and Engineering teams to execute action plans to help shape the future of video product solutions. Work with cross-functional teams such as marketing for key sales events.
