We are partnering a Leading Global Bank to recruit for their Compliance team. This is a stable bank with extensive international network and regional headquarter in Singapore. It is an excellent opportunity to join as a Compliance Team Lead to support their Treasury business. Responsibilities You will lead a small team in providing Compliance support to the Bank's Treasury's business. You will act as a trusted Compliance advisor to the business on the interpretation of regulations. Keeping abreast of new regulatory changes, you will provide updates to relevant stakeholders; perform gap analysis; develop, enhance and implement revised framework, policies and procedures to ensure the adherence to evolving regulations. You will plan and conduct compliance testing & review and provide recommendations to rectify the weaknesses identified. You will develop and execute a compliance monitoring and surveillance program on trading and communications. You will liaise with external stakeholders including regulators and external auditors. There are opportunities to participate in ad hoc Bank initiatives and projects. Requirements You are degree qualified with at least 8 years of experience in Compliance and well versed with MAS banking rules and regulations i.e. SFA/FAA. You have strong knowledge of Treasury products and services and Treasury related industry practices. Experience dealing with regulators will be advantageous. You are hands-on, collaborative and possess strong interpersonal, communication and influencing skills. Candidates with legal background are welcome to apply. To Apply To apply, please submit your resume to Christina Tay at cr@kerryconsulting.com, quoting the job title and reference number CR22152. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

National University of Singapore seeks a highly motivated and an organized scientist with a background in life sciences/biological sciences with technical knowledge in omics technologies specially metabolomics, good knowledge of metabolism, biomarker discovery and interest in working with community partners/stakeholders (farmers, clinicians, government agencies, scientific organizations). The candidate should also have background and interest in project, team and resource management and willing to contribute to certain administrative activities. The position is within a multi-disciplinary research team, which broadly pursues microbial diversity and physiological investigations on plants systems/agriculture/human systems and allied domains. The team consists of Post-doctoral fellows, PhDs and other Research Assistants. Qualifications Candidates should have a PhD in biological sciences/food/biochemistry, integrative omics, with demonstrated experience (at least three peer reviewed publications in international journals) in the above-mentioned areas A self-initiated researcher with an innate capacity for systemic and cross-disciplinary thinking Ability to understand and integrate concepts from multiple disciplines, especially ecology, metabolism and plant/human physiology and data science platforms Interest in higher level program management activities and support the team in related aspects Ideally have demonstrated cross-disciplinary experience working across industry, academia and community Experience in science communication, event organization is preferred *We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.*

The Centre for Quantum Technologies (CQT) is a research centre of excellence in Singapore. It brings together physicists, computer scientists and engineers to do basic research on quantum physics and to build devices based on quantum phenomena. Experts in this new discipline of quantum technologies are applying their discoveries in computing, communications, and sensing. CQT is hosted by the National University of Singapore and also has staff at Nanyang Technological University. With some 180 researchers and students, it offers a friendly and international work environment. Job Description The team of Alexander Ling develops quantum light sources and detectors for deployable quantum communications. An emphasis is on the development of compact sources of entangled photon pairs. The team has an immediate vacancy for a post-doctoral research fellow who will be able to lead this effort. The successful candidate will join a multi-disciplinary team of scientists and engineers to study the science of entanglement generation and distribution, and to co-develop the next generation of optical devices. Job Requirements PhD degree in Physics Relevant experience and training in the relevant science and technologies Excellent written and spoken English

Strong programming skill in C#, ASP.NET, ASP.NET MVC, ASP.NET Core, Entity Framework, LINQ, jQuery, Angular and Bootstrap. Having working experience in ASP.NET Core, Angular & DevOps would be an advantage. Deep knowledge in Relational Database Management System (RDBMS) such as Oracle and SQL. The incumbent will responsible for processing, organizing and analyzing security telemetry collected from various NUS systems to identify and report on emerging cyber threats targeting NUS, especially from known threat actors. This includes the acquisition and curation of cyber intelligence data from various sources to supplement and enrich existing logs.' Duties & Responsibilities Conduct proactive threat hunting and analysis using the following intelligence sources for actionable IOCs/TTPs, open source vendor and private sources internal sources government partners Develop preventive actions and countermeasures for detected IOCs/TTPs. Develop SIEM (Splunk) rules and use cases for monitoring relevant IOCs/TTPs. Identify emerging threat concerns and intelligence requirements. Generate new IOCs/TTPs based on telemetry collected. Develop reports and deliver briefings for various levels of management with regards to current and emerging threats. Collaborate with other teams to integrate and automate threat intelligence with security tools. Evaluate new threat feeds and their relevance to the environment. Evaluate and implement a Threat Intelligence Platform. Assist in incident investigation and forensics. Qualifications Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent qualification. At least 5 years of experience in cybersecurity with at least 3 years in handling cyber-threat intelligence related work. Knowledge of prominent cyber threat actors and APT groups. Experience with Threat Intelligence Platforms. Experience with SIEM (especially Splunk) and SOAR (especially Demisto). Scripting skills such as Python, Perl, PHP. Certifications such as GCTI or equivalent will be an added advantage

Job_Descriptions: The successful candidate will work with Assistant Professor Anjan Soumyanarayanan on Electrical Characterization of Spintronic Devices under a project on Spin-Orbit Technologies for Intelligence at the Edge (SpOT-LITE). The main responsibilities of the position include - Design and fabrication of ultrathin magnetic film and devices. Design and setup of electrical probe station apparatus. Electrical characterization (DC,RF) measurements and analysis. Data interpretation and manuscript writing. Job_Title: Research Fellow, Department of Computer Science
Job_Descriptions: The National University of Singapore invites applications for the position of Research Fellow in the Department of Computer Science, School of Computing (SoC). SoC is strongly committed to research excellence in all its dimensions: Searching for fundamental results and insights, developing novel computational solutions to a wide range of applications, building large-scale experimental systems and improving the well-being of society. We seek to play an active role both internationally and locally in the core and emerging areas of Computer Science and Information Systems. The Research Fellow will be responsible for working closely with the Principal Investigator and lab members on deep learning for 3D computer vision. He/she should possess experience or interest in the following research areas: 3D computer vision Deep learning Machine learning Qualifications Job requirements: A PhD degree in a relevant area; Excellent programming ability in Python/C/C++ Excellent knowledge in  deep learning frameworks, e.g., PyTorch, Tensorflow, Nengo Good written and verbal communication skills in English Familiarity with non-fully supervised learning Prior publications in major computer vision (CVPR/ICCV/ECCV) or machine learning (NeurIPS, ICML/ICLR) conferences is a plus.

An NUS biosensing research team is seeking a highly motivated, team-oriented research fellow to develop a novel fluorescence super-resolution microscopy based on DNA-PAINT approach to investigate cell biology. Working together with an established microscopy team, the successful candidate will be responsible for the design of DNA barcodes suitable for visualization of molecular/nano-scaled structures and subsequently cell surface molecular events. Qualifications Ph.D. degree in Chemistry, Physics, Bioengineering or a related field. 3 years of experience in DNA origami, DNA ciruit, or relevant DNA nanotechnology field. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. A desire to work in a fast paced, team development environment.

The lab of Dr. Yu Haojie in Department of Biochemistry, Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine, National University of Singapore (https://medicine.nus.edu.sg/bch/faculty/yu-haojie/) is seeking a highly motivated candidate to fill an open postdoctoral role exploring lipid metabolism in cardiometabolic diseases. The mission of Yu lab is to find new therapeutic strategies for atherosclerotic coronary artery disease and NASH. We use cutting-edge technologies such as single cell sequencing, functional genomics and CRISPR/Cas9-based screening, to understand how alterations in lipid metabolism and trafficking contribute to NASH and atherosclerotic plaque progression and regression. Qualifications The candidate must have: 1. A PhD or equivalent in molecular biology, biochemistry, cell biology, or related field. 2. Extensive experience in molecular biology and mouse work as demonstrated by a first author publication in a relevant scientific journal. 3. Willingness to work with mice. 4. Excellent communication and teamwork skills. 5. The ability to work independently to design and troubleshoot experiments. 6. Positive attitude and strong motivation. Preference will be given to candidates with prior in vivo mouse experience or prior experience with metabolism or cardiovascular research. Qualified candidates should contact Dr. Haojie Yu (*******@nus.edu.sg) with a cover letter, CV, the names and contact of three referees, and a PDF of relevant first-author publication. Additional Information At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students is one of our utmost priorities and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require significant amount of physical interactions with student / staff / public members. As such, we regret to inform that job applicants need to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 for successful employment with NUS.

The Research Fellow will be responsible for undertaking in-depth research in machine learning and big data for the Grab-NUS AI Lab to solve real-world transportation challenges with rigorous research in AI and data science. Phase II of the Grab-NUS AI Lab will focus on computer vision, NLP, and AI explainability. The research should lead to both publications in top-tier international conferences and journals, as well as real-world industry implementations. He/she will be working closely with the Principal Investigator and lab members on one or more research projects together with Grab data scientists on interesting and challenging real world datasets and problem statements. Responsibilities: Design and develop new state-of-the-art algorithms and applications in machine learning and artificial intelligence for the transportation and e-payment domains, with a focus on computer vision, NLP, and AI explainability; Write high-quality research papers to be published at top-tier international research venues; Contribute to knowledge exchange and technology transfer activities with industry partners and collaborators; Develop ideas for application of research outcomes. Requirements: A PhD in Computer Science, with specialization related to machine learning, data mining, artificial intelligence or databases; Proven ability to conduct independent research with a strong and relevant publication record; Expertise in computer vision, NLP, or AI explainability; Experienced in using the latest machine learning, AI, and big data platforms; Excellent interpersonal communication and oral presentation skills in English. This position involves working on a project related to communication learning for joint cooperation in large multi-agent systems. The objective of this position includes contributing to the model development, solution, and implementation of novel communication learning methods using advanced reinforcement learning tools such as Graph Neural Networks. These models, once trained, will also be validated and tested in simulation on standard benchmarks (e.g., Starcraft Multi-Agent Challenge), as well as on actual robotic hardware on a number of cooperative multi-robot tasks (e.g., multi-agent pathfinding, search, or collaborative manipulation). The role involves the opportunity to work with the research team within the Mechanical Engineering department at the National University of Singapore. The successful candidate will be self-motivated with an outstanding track record in computer science, robotics, machine learning (in particular, reinforcement learning), or related disciplines. The main research tasks for the project include but will not be limited to: - Developing novel decentralized communication learning methods to enable and improve cooperation in large multi-agent systems, based on local sensing and decision-making, and by relying on/extending recent reinforcement learning tools. - Testing the devised models against state-of-the-art methods in standard simulation-based benchmarks widely used by the community. - Implementing and testing the devised models on actual hardware, to experimentally validate their use and test their limit under real-life conditions. - Coordinating a small team of researchers at different levels (e.g., FYP students, remote/on-site interns, master's students). - Write papers and present work at top-tier local or international conferences or workshops. Qualifications - BEng/BSc/MEng/MSc in Computer Science, Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or related disciplines. - Experience in developing communication learning models using recent reinforcement learning methods, and applying these models to standard benchmark tasks (e.g., Starcraft Multi-Agent Challenge). - Interest and/or experience implementing machine learning models on robotic hardware. - Proficiency with GNU/Linux, Python/C++ and at least one of the main machine learning libraries (e.g., tensorflow, keras, pytorch, CAFFE). - Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. - Good teamwork abilities, self-motivation and self-reflection. - Proficiency in English language, both in oral and written form.

A Postdoctoral Fellow position is available for PhD holders with experience in neuroscience and stem cell biology research. The successful candidate will manage and execute research projects (including design, conduct, collection of experiments and data analyses) and provide support to the Principal Investigator and his team. Qualifications Candidates should possess strong background and working knowledge of molecular biology, cell biology and biochemical techniques such as cell culture, cloning, real-time PCR, western blotting, immunoprecipitation, immunofluorescence-based microscopy. Candidates with familiarity in the handling of viral vectors and stem cells are highly desirable. Experience in animal handling, breeding and behavioural studies would be an advantage. Candidates are expected to be able to work both independently and in team-based projects, be able to effectively communicate in written and spoken English. Applications should include full curriculum vitae, publication list, information on years of experience in research and laboratory work, and names and contact information (email and telephone numbers) of 3 referees. Additional Information At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students is one of our utmost priorities and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require significant amount of physical interactions with student / staff / public members. Even for job roles that can be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presence is required. With effect from 15 January 2022, based on Singapore’s legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able work at the NUS premises. As such, we regret to inform that job applicants need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated for successful employment with NUS.

KYC Analyst, Corporate & Investment Banking Job Summary Singapore Permanent BBBH803888 Jan 17, 2022 Competitive Job Description Morgan McKinley is working in partnership with an European Corporate and Institutional Banking client with strong footprints and relationship in the APAC region. The Singapore team is looking for mutiple new headcounts in their KYC department to support the growth of their KYC checker team in Singapore. Reporting to the team leads, you will be assigned to either the Onboarding or Periodic Review team and be expected to provide your KYC expertise in the respective domains. Role and responsibilities To perform KYC due diligence of new relationships and existing clients (periodical revisions) for Hong Kong, Singapore, China, Malaysia, Australia, Taiwan and Japan entities as a Maker or Checker To conduct checks and due diligence on these clients primarily looking out for PEP/Adverse news/information that may be detrimental to the reputation of the bank To liaise and coordinate with Front Office and Client Services Team on the collection of the KYC documents/information To escalate complex cases to local Compliance and/or Head Office Financial Security for advice, clarification or validation where applicable To provide guidance and sharing of KYC knowledge to the junior team members in the team and other departments Inputting and Maintenance of the Static Data/Accounts of the Clients into the KYC Database Ensure accurate and proper maintenance of statistics for timely MIS reporting/other ad-hoc reports and perform monthly reconciliation on the KYC Status versus Opened Accounts of the Existing Clients (when required) To take part in Projects and perform UAT testing assigned by the Manager To perform ad-hoc screenings and other duties assigned by the Manager Key requirements Bachelor's Degree Holder in Banking & Finance or equivalent Minimum 2-3 years of experience in KYC / CDD, preferably in Corporate Investment Banking with a good understanding of AML/CFT Framework and KYC documentation processes Good understanding of the AML/KYC Regulatory Requirements in Asia (in particular HKMA, MAS, CBRC, PBOC, PRA, FSC and FSA) Strong verbal communication Strong Interpersonal skills with ability to effectively interact with cross functional teams and capable of working on own initiative and prioritizing work load Highly organized with excellent attention to detail, highly motivated and able to work with minimal supervision. Ability to multi-task and execute task with a sense of urgency and with ultimate goal of delivering tasks on time Strong Team player Good Knowledge with Excel will be an advantage If you are interested in the role and would like to discuss the opportunity further, please click apply now or email Hagen at hlee@morganmckinley.com for more information. Job_Title: Global Lead, LNG Strategic Engagement & Intelligence
Job_Descriptions: Global Lead, LNG Strategic Engagement & Intelligence The Role: Global Lead, LNG Strategic Engagement & Intelligence Grade ( relevant for internal applicants only ): 11 The Location: Singapore The Team: The Strategic Engagement and Intelligence Group (SEIG) is a 14-member global team that is responsible for the global development and execution of the content team's commodity groups' engagement and intelligence strategic plans. Additionally, the SEIG serves as bridge-builders internally across content, commercial, marketing, client services and products teams, and more importantly, a bridge to our many stakeholders in the external market. In addition to strategic planning and execution and working across multiple departments. The team supports presentation requests and also drives the continuous improvement of best practices in market engagement. The Impact: The role is critical to driving effective engagement for existing and developing high-profile price benchmarks in LNG, as well as connecting the LNG market back to our efforts in Gen Fuels, crude oil and energy transition. The role plays a key part in leading and coordinating growing commercial requests for engagement in the LNG space. What's in it for you: Become an integral leader in the SEIG; and bridge that leadership to the global LNG team. Get exposure to the content leadership team and across the broader Platts leadership teams. Gain cross-departmental exposure in working with the commercial/marketing teams. Lead the formation of engagement strategy and priorities Acquire deep knowledge across the global LNG markets Become recognized as a market expert in the LNG industry - with opportunities to speak at events and engage with key companies in, associations and government leaders in the sector. Interact with professionals, including C-Suite and other decisionmakers in the LNG industry Assess the impact of engagement and ensure continuous improvement across external activities. Responsibilities: Lead the development of LNG global engagement strategy and communications plans; and iterate and maintain those plans throughout the annual cycle per SEIG best practice Lead quarterly the LNG Engagement Strategy Board and ensure follow upon actions as a part of executing the team's strategy. Develop and maintain a strong understanding of the global LNG market Develop new contacts and relationships across the global LNG market Prepare to present externally on key messaging and insights that are developed by the LNG team. Coordinate/lead/monitor global LNG engagement activities leveraging and seeding SEIG best practices across the LNG team. Lead response to commercial and client services requests for LNG market-facing inquiries. Basic Qualifications: Knowledge of Platts pricing processes, products and content underpinned by strong curiosity and desire to continuously learn. Previous experience in engaging clients or sources in markets Leadership capabilities with a focus on strong influencing skills for both internal and external networks and the ability to work in matrix positions. Strategic mindset with strong planning skills, and an adaptable mindset. Superior communication skills including: Public speaking experience; good listening skills and strong written and oral capabilities Strong leadership, communication and critical thinking capabilities Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint and the Microsoft office suite Undergraduate degree Preferred Qualifications: Knowledge of the LNG market Project/planning or management experience Price reporting experience preferred Understanding of regulatory issues in the region Multilingual capabilities a plus Use of Tableau; Dynamic CRM Willingness to travel 40% or more S&P Global Platts At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with confidence. We're the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping. S&P Global Platts is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.platts.com . Some roles may include a trading prohibition and remediation of positions when there is an effective or potential conflict of interest. Employment at S&P Global is contingent upon compliance with the Policy. Strategic Thinking:Effectively translates the vision into specific business objectives, thinks of different ways to do things and through all angles to provide insights and develop strategies that guide future decisions. Organizational Savvy:Understands DTCC’s products and service offerings, as well as key stakeholders, and demonstrates the ability to form and cultivate internal networks that will help navigate getting things done. Financial Acumen: Understands business financials and has the ability to work with complex data and information, and adopts practical and workable approaches. Preference will be given to those with direct experience in Business Management or directly supporting the COO. In-depth knowledge of the derivatives or trade reporting industry, trade matching and clearing, derivatives processing and documentation Excellent communication (verbal, written) and interpersonal skills with the confidence and credibility to manage multiple global relationships, as well as influencing and stakeholder management skills Proven ability to manage multiple priorities with a results oriented attitude and a focus on accuracy, high quality standards and timely delivery Ability to handle ambiguity comfortably and to conceptualise unfamiliar topics/areas/information, while also proposing logical solutions for the next course of action. Sound knowledge of Microsoft applications: Excel/Word/Powerpoint. Bachelor's degree preferred with Master’s or equivalent experience About DTCC DTCC safeguards the financial markets and helps them run efficiently, in times of prosperity and crisis. We are uniquely positioned at the center of global trading activity, processing over 100 million financial transactions every day, pioneering industry-wide, post-trade solutions and maintaining multiple data and operating centers worldwide. From where we stand, we can anticipate the industry’s needs and we’re working to continually improve the world’s most resilient, secure and efficient market infrastructure. Our employees are driven to deliver innovative technologies that improve efficiency, lower cost and bring stability and certainty to the post-trade lifecycle. DTCC proudly supports Flexible Work Arrangements favoring openness and gives people freedom to do their jobs well, by encouraging diverse opinions and emphasizing teamwork.  When you join our team, you’ll have an opportunity to make meaningful contributions at a company that is recognized as a thought leader in both the financial services and technology industries. A DTCC career is more than a good way to earn a living. It’s the chance to make a difference at a company that’s truly one of a kind. About the Team DTCC Solutions delivers information-based and business processing solutions to financial intermediaries globally. DTCC's Product Management teams are responsible for developing and delivering DTCC products and services to clients across our core businesses while ensuring product competitiveness. Product Management activities range from product strategy and business planning to marketing and sales, customer experience, financial management and project management.

Company Description About Experian Experian is the world’s leading global information services company. During life’s big moments — from buying a home or a car to sending a child to college to growing a business by connecting with new customers — we empower consumers and our clients to manage their data with confidence. What you’ll be doing Handle full set of accounts for clients: Book-keeping Preparing ECI (Estimated Chargeable Income) Performing GST reconciliation and filing of GST Qualifications What you’ll need to bring to the party At least 1-year accounting experience (Fresh graduate/ No working experience can be considered) At least a LCCI Diploma in Accounting or equivalent Able to work independently Good team player Good communicator, persuasive and enterprising Good written and oral communication skills; articulate and persuasive presence and speaking experience required Good problem-solving and analytical skills Self-motivated, goal/result oriented and works well under pressure Knowledge of QuickBooks Desktop/Online, XERO software is an advantage

The Applied Intelligence division of BAE Systems delivers solutions which protect and enhance the connected world. Everything we do creates a safer future. We want to solve problems for our customers and by bringing together great minds, we can work together to make the world a safer place. The Applied Intelligence business of BAE Systems delivers solutions which help to protect and enhance the connected world. Our solutions combine large scale data exploitation, 'intelligencegrade' security and complex services and solutions integration. We operate in four key domains of expertise: Cyber Security, Financial Crime, Communications Intelligence and Digital Transformation. Today, we have staff across the UK and Europe, the Americas, Asia Pacific and the Middle East. Our people apply intelligence to protect and enhance national and organisational assets so that they can grow and prosper - from improving the health and efficiency of leading corporations to protecting critical infrastructures, safeguarding vulnerable people and catching criminals. Together, we make the world a safer place. Make everyday matter About The Team: A successful candidate for this role will work in Applied Intelligence's Singapore Hub, with a focus on delivering and support complex systems to our customers. The Role - Junior System Consultant (Project Deployment): The Junior System Consultant (Project Deployment) is a member of the Singapore Engineering Team. Junior System Consultants (Project Deployment) are trained to be hybrid Infrastructure/Application Deployment Engineers who ensure perfect execution on project tasks. They are Deployment Engineers with strong emphasis on IT fundamentals capable of taking on different technology stacks and yet care deeply about delivery milestones. Their versatility on the ground is fundamental to company success by constructing highly complex system or perform tactical upgrades to propel the project business. In this role, the selected candidate is the system builder (solo or team depending on project size), working with very large dataset, and solving hard engineering problems at scale to help our customers defend against threats, reducing their risk in the connected world. Head of Business Continuity Management The Role: Head of Business Continuity Management Grade ( relevant for internal applicants only ): 13 The Location: London, Houston, New York, Denver, Singapore What We're Looking For: We are seeking a knowledgeable and energetic Business Continuity Specialist with excellent business continuity management / disaster recovery / crisis management experience, to develop, maintain and manage the business continuity program of S&P Global Platts expanding global business. The job holder will liaise extensively with all business operations, combining efforts into a single business continuity plan and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements, industry standards and S&P Global's overall Risk Management requirements. As a business continuity SME you will ensure effective controls are in place and support all activities necessary to enable S&P Global Platts to respond to a business disruption. This is a very challenging role within a thriving and dynamic environment and will require coordination across teams in USA, EMEA and APAC. The Business Continuity Specialist will report directly to the S&P Global Platts Head of Business Operations. Responsibilities: Update BCM policies and procedures Build a Business Impact Analysis (BIA) to assess internal and external threats and the risk they pose to the S&P Global Platts and recommend mitigation strategies to reduce or eliminate identified risks Develop an enterprise-wide BCM strategy leveraging existing efforts and best practices Ensure that all potential business risk factors are considered (loss of access to primary office, transport disruptions, IT failures, data loss, cyber-attack, reliance on 3rd party vendors, key personnel, etc.) Drive and develop the content of BCM plans and documentation for core operational areas which includes, business resumption, recovery, restoration and disaster recovery plans that allows for business continuation in the event of disruptions or disasters Communicate the BCM plans to all relevant stakeholders for signoff Provide education and awareness to all individuals as to the importance of effective business continuity plans and their role in the event of a disruption to business operations Provide overall governance and direction setting of the program on an ongoing basis Drive the delivery of BCM plans to an agreed timeframe Coordinate the activities amongst various BCM work streams and liaise with their BCM counterparts in other divisions Work closely with technology teams to ensure their disaster recovery plans for critical systems and applications are consistent with the plans developed for BCM Provide support in the event of a business disruption to manage the response coordination and communications Coordinate BCP testing program and actively participate in testing scenarios Document any issues experienced and lessons learned in a business disruption / test and track the progress to resolve open issues Ensure that BCM plans are developed to maintain and/or restore business processes within required timescales following interruption to, or failure of, critical business processes Assist with the companies governance structure for crisis management & continuity planning Escalate risks and coordinate mitigating responses Develop status reports on location continuity plans and prepare management reports as necessary Provides leadership and advice to assist other departments with BCM budgets and activities Ensure compliance with evolving regulatory requirements and industry standards Provide subject matter expertise on BCM to include appropriate legal and regulatory requirements Propels other similar facilities programs for occupant health and safety (evacuation drills, coordination of exit plans, and similar) Other duties as requested by supervisor. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor degree of management information system, business administration or related degree and ideally with certificate from a recognized professional BCM body Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in Business Continuity Management / Disaster Recovery / Crisis Management Proven experience in business continuity management/crisis management topics driving the BCM Program through influencing senior business leaders, facilitating decision making and managing cross-functional teams in multi-cultural environment. Good knowledge about ISO 22301 or similar Industry Standards A strong understanding of Operational risk and resilience, Business Process improvement methods as well as risk related control frameworks and practices (COCO, COSO, ISO, ITIL, CMM, COBIT, etc.), Project / Program Management skills - demonstrable track record successfully managing projects at the highest technical and tactical levels, coordinating multi-discipline projects Excellent analytical skills and understanding of processes, risks and controls Exceptional risks and issues management, change control Good communicator Excellent command of English (verbal/written) Highly developed interpersonal skills with ability to effectively communicate and influence decision-making with senior management Ability to work with a global team Energetic, Self-starter, Flexible and Goal-oriented Business minded, well-organized team worker with strong problem solving and leadership skills Compensation/Benefits Information (US Applicants Only): S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $121,600 to $252,500 . Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location. In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan. This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires . We're the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping. VP, Credit Analyst, Global Markets VP, Credit Analyst, Global Markets Posting Date: 30-Jan-2022 Location: Raffles Place, Singapore, SG Company: United Overseas Bank Limited About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values - Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Global Market function leverages our in-depth knowledge of markets to provide timely financial advice, products and solutions to our clients. Together with our segment managers, we manage our clients' investment, liability and risk management needs through a comprehensive suite of treasury products and services across multiple asset classes. Job Responsibilities The Credit and Risk Management function is comprised of three teams: Risk Management, Credit and Special Asset Management. We manage the risks arising from the Group's business activities within the risk appetite established by the Board. This involves identifying and evaluating the risks, developing effective risk governance and strategies as well as providing independent assessment of the overall risk profile. The Credit Analyst has a key role to perform credit, business and financial analysis on issuers or counterparties. Key responsibilities are: Propose internal credit ratings and prepare fresh credit propositions/annual reviews for issuers or counterparties covered by Global Markets (GM), ensuring adherence to the Bank's internal policies. Evaluate the overall credit worthiness of the issuer or counterparty and assess their ability to meet credit obligations periodically, and alert business in the event of any adverse conditions/news. Assist to review existing GM's credit frameworks in consultation with other functions in the bank. Perform control and reporting activities required for issuers or counterparties covered. Conduct analysis on market issuances for potential business opportunities. Work with GM front office to support all credit-related matters. Work with Group Credit to fulfill requirements to support Global Markets business. Job Requirements Degree in Business/Accounting/Finance with at least 10 years of relevant experience, or comparable professional qualifications. Experience in conducting credit and financial analysis independently preferably with banks, NBFIs or credit rating agencies. Good understanding and knowledge of the corporate and/or FI bond space. Able to work independently and as a team to deliver consistent good quality outcomes within stipulated timeline in a dynamic environment. Good communication and presentation skills. Strong skills in data analysis and working knowledge of business intelligence tools will be advantageous. Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

Description Description BrokerTec is the industry-leading anonymous dealer-to-dealer electronic trading platform for fixed income markets. BrokerTec provides technology solutions across a wide range of products to customers in more than 50 countries around the world. It facilitates API and manual trading solutions for many U.S. and European fixed income products, including U.S. Treasuries, European Government Bonds and European Repo. This role will help support the Singapore based overnight desk with a focus on the core product offerings, new products, and enhancements to existing products. The Senior Director will report to the London based Global Managing Director of BrokerTec as well as locally to senior management. Principal Accountabilities: '¢ As a valuable member of the Singapore Brokertec team, Increase volumes and revenue in the region by working as a partner with our diverse and growing customer base. Deliver product, account management and support that benefit the entire market with reliability, integrity and transparency. '¢ Help drive the BrokerTec global strategy regionally by supporting our market leading trading platform in order to create value and improve the customer trading experience from execution to settlement and clearing. '¢ Collaborate with other divisions within CME including Client Development and Sales, Marketing in order to achieve BrokerTec's business goals and objectives. '¢ Assist in understanding and reacting to the market structure; monitoring the competitive landscape; protecting and growing our core business. Skills and Software Requirements: '¢ Bachelor's degree required At least 5yrs in client facing roles in the financial markets preferred. '¢ Operational understanding of how banks, hedge funds, high frequency trading firms or platform providers utilize electronic trading platforms to optimize their businesses and adapt to meet the changing financial landscape. '¢ Strong technical and analytical skills with direct experience in the US Fixed Income Market. '¢ Experience in managing and maintaining relationships within a diverse group of clients executing on our electronic trading platforms. '¢ Ability to comprehend and sell new product offerings within the fixed income trading community '¢ Ability to quickly address client needs across a wide spectrum of time sensitive demands from execution, STP, settlement, and connectivity support functions. '¢ Deep understanding of changing market structure and landscape with a desire to influence and impact change. CME Group: Where Futures Are Made CME Group () is the world's leading and most diverse derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Joining our company gives you the opportunity to make a difference in global financial markets every day, whether you work on our industry-leading technology and risk management services, our benchmark products or in a corporate services area that helps us serve our customers better. With 2,500 employees located around the world, we're small enough for you and your contributions to be known. But big enough for your ideas to make an impact. The pace is dynamic, the work is unlike any other firm in the business, and the possibilities are endless. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we're looking for more. For EU Residents, the Candidate Privacy Policy can be found here.

Manager, Change Management About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities We are seeking a talented and passionate individual to join Standard Chartered as a Change Manager in the Strategy team within Enterprise Architecture, Strategy & Transformation (EAST) with a strong leaning towards communications. You will be an experienced Change Manager, meaning you are someone experienced in ensuring transformation becomes embedded through a combination of activities that involve training, communicating, taking on feedback and adapting initiatives to accommodate. In this role you will support a multi-year transformation of our Enterprise Technology organisation with a focus on delivering value to all our customers while accelerating the speed to market for the delivery of services. Enterprise Technology is a global organisation providing Cloud, Data, End User, Infrastructure, Integration, IT Service Management, Network and Security capabilities to all our clients and colleagues globally with an operating budget of $500mil USD and $200mil USD of change. We are committed to delivering our vision of Making Technology Frictionless through our Lotus Programme which drives our transformation agenda to shape how we work differently (New Ways of Working, Service Transformation, and People & Culture), how we re-engineer process and how we decision through great architecture (Tools & Processes) and how we better utilise what we have and retire that which we don't need (Cost Optimisation & Efficiency). The successful candidate will need to: Be an experienced change manager who will play a key role in ensuring change initiatives meet objectives on time and on budget by ensuring adoption and usage. Be an excellent communicator, written and verbal at senior management level down to individual technical teams and possess the ability to tailor the vision and messages appropriately to the given audience whilst preserving strategic intent. Have the ability to operate in matrix teams, and influence direction and strategy of a technology organisation. Must be able to demonstrate a good understanding of the different core infrastructure components used by the bank to deliver service to the business and be able to apply strategic context to each. Articulate vision and influence senior decision makers across Enterprise Technology and key stakeholders across Technology & Innovation more broadly. Ideally have experience and understanding of operations and experience of transition of products to service. Communications Excellent understanding of the Group's business strategy and model appropriate to the role. Develop and execute communications plan for various business units. Create compelling key messages, statements and articles for senior management and a wide-reaching internal audience. Work with key stakeholders to effectively manage issues and crisis in a proactive and timely manner. Must be a confident communicator and presenter. Strong writing, editing, proofreading, layout and design, professional printing/publishing skills are essential, including ability to present concepts verbally. Have excellent organizational and planning skills. Business Forge relationships with CIO business lines to understand their project deliverables and ensure full alignment with the Enterprise Technology project portfolio. Work with stakeholders to define business and technical requirements for communications and build support for these business cases. Drive a systematic approach to communication and training with key stakeholders and partners to lift the level of awareness of cost drivers, opportunities and risks, and future planning needs. Create standardized monthly executive level packs Working to a brief to produce monthly and ad-hoc data analysis and reporting Processes Lead and implement change initiatives related to business processes and technologies. Drive adoption and proficiency of changes within the organization in compliance with client's Change Management methodologies. Develop project strategies and plans, including stakeholder assessment, communications, leadership alignment, organization transition, change readiness, capability transfer, and end-user training. Oversee team execution in accordance with project plans, tools, and methods, and support resource planning and acquisition. Develop short and long-term goals, KPIs, and objectives, and develop and execute against annual operational plan. Lead/facilitate meetings with client to ensure an understanding of the current company culture, and jointly develop a change adoption plan. Provide direct support and coaching to front-line managers and supervisors as they help their direct reports through transitions. Facilitate change management activities with cross-functional team members and stakeholders to understand and ensure adoption of the Enterprise Business Transformation. Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Key Stakeholders Global Technology Heads Management Team Heads Finance Partners Service Owners Contract Owners Vendor Management and Supplier Chain Management Technology & Innovation, TS Finance Partner Technology & Innovation, Governance & Change CIO Technology Strategy Other Responsibilities Here for good and Group's brand and values in Singapore, Technology & Innovation; Perform other responsibilities assigned under Group, Country, Business or Functional policies and procedures. Our Ideal Candidate Bachelor's Degree or tertiary qualification in a related field. 8 years of relevant experience. Financial Services industry experience and or prior experience in a transformation, change or communications role would be an advantage. Job_Title: VP, Technical Delivery Manager - Core Banking/Group Technology
Job_Descriptions: About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches. Key objective is to ensure good quality and smooth delivery of core banking enhancements that are fully in compliance with mandated framework and guidelines. Role will involve management of project technical delivery with a view for end-to-end flow, requirements management, active engagement/participation in design and development, management of testing requirements; and planning for deployment and support. 1.    Project delivery management Plan technical deliverables (including any system enhancements and upgrades) to meet Project's requirements within allocated budget Manage and coordinate across different application teams to manage technical dependencies of the solution Monitor and manage risks/issues related to technical delivery Provide status update related to technical delivery Report to Program and/or Project Manager for the strategic programs 2.    Requirement management Partner with Functional Business Analysts, System Analysts & subject matter experts to understand and implement functional and technical requirements Provide systems input to specification phase (e.g., effort estimates, high-level delivery plan) based on security and control standards Partner with Development Manager in managing application teams to build the enhancements 4.    Test management Partner with Test Manager to ensure completion of SIT, UAT testing, performance/load testing and application security testing with quality results Work with IT Security team to facilitate completion of penetration testing and remediation of findings in accordance with Mitigation Plan 5.    Implementation management Prepare technical implementation plan across application teams Coordinate technical implementation activities across application teams to ensure production cutover and adequate post-implementation support Job Requirements Bachelor's Degree in related Information Technology disciplines Relevant Experience in Banking / Information Technology Knowledge in demand and time deposits domain of core banking platform in wholesale and/or retail banking industry Knowledge in IBM AS400 platform, RPG, CL programming Possess strong quantitative, analytical, problem solving and process design skills to translate analysis into solutions that meet business objectives Curious person with strong problem solving & analytical skills Having open mind set and always keen to learn beyond domains under charge so as to build up more holistic knowledge Excellent communication (written and verbal) and inter-personal skills to manage technical and non-technical stakeholders across multiple business units Able to work independently and have a keen eye on details Resourceful team player, who can work on multiple assignments, with minimal guidance Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment. A Senior Project Manager Construction is needed to take responsibility for the delivery of the construction element of a massive resort expansion development in Singapore. The project is now underway so this is a live urgent construction job vacancy requiring urgent applications from suitably experienced project managers. Project Details You will be stationed on the project in down-town Singapore. Responsibilities and Duties Reporting to the Director of Development and Project Management, the Senior Project Manager is responsible for all aspects of the onsite process and construction of major projects within the Department of Design and Project Management team or as required by the department head. The set role will include involvement at an early stage in the development of the project with the majority of the role concentrating on the delivery aspect of the defined works. The successful candidate must have commercial construction industry experience on major fit-out, A & A projects with experience in live working environment preferable. Job responsibilities: Assist the Design team with design management, design coordination and design delivery to meet the project schedule. Monitor and control the progress and development of all related project deliverables through the various stages of the project in accordance with the client's policy. Lead & provide expertise, guidance, advice, support and motivate project teams. Report to senior management via meetings or by regular written reports the progress of related project matters together with the status of related issues. Manage and prepare all reporting activities required for the Project Stakeholders. Communicate effectively with Operations Teams to identify needs and evaluate alternative Project solutions. Involve in the selection of the Consultants as well as in the negotiation of their terms and conditions of engagement with the Procurement team, including giving advice on the most suitable forms of tender and contract. Oversee and ensure that Change Management as it relates to budget, revised design and potential schedule impact is carried out in line with client procedures. Work and liaise with the Design team on project matters, and also initiate value engineering initiatives to ensure that the project develops within the recognized cost and time constraints. Coordinate and integrate the activities of the assistant project managers, project engineers and other support staff on the project. Regularly inspect the progress of the work on site and provide guidance to the project and construction management teams on best practices and potential efficiencies on scheduling and processes. Oversee and support the Construction Management Team to ensure the adequate and timely flow of information, designs, technical data and feedback, to meet the stringent construction schedule requirements on the project. Plan and Implement Procedure and Quality Checks for assigned projects. Desired Skills and Experience 15+ years previous work experience as a Senior Project Manager, preferably in an A & A related field Knowledge of construction, engineering, procurement, industry standards and other project-related activities, their interfaces and interdependencies. Strong communication skills, as well as the ability to visualize issues and communicate them to others. Outstanding organization, coordination and leadership skills – ability to coordinate groups of Consultants / Contractors. Ability to work in a team environment. Ability for prolonged periods of time to walk, stand, stretch, bend and kneel. Work in a fast-paced and busy environment. Work indoors and be exposed to various environmental factors such as, but not limited to, CRT, noise, dust, and cigarette smoke. Qualifications/Educational Requirements Tertiary Degree in a Construction/Building/Project Management/Engineering related field. Manager, Strategy About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities We are seeking a talented and passionate individual to join Standard Chartered as a Strategy Manager. In this role you will help drive and oversee the strategy for Technology & Innovation and Enterprise Technology . This role will also play a critical part in helping shape and guide the future growth and development of Enterprise Technology (ET), being responsible for the creation and transformation of the capabilities that will define how we organise to deliver on the strategy. This includes owning both the end to end organisational operating model and the Enterprise Technology that underpins the products and services delivers. Enterprise Technology is a global organisation providing Cloud, Data, End User, Infrastructure, Integration, IT Service Management, Network and Security capabilities to all our clients and colleagues globally with an operating budget of $500mil USD and $200mil USD of change. To be successful, this person will need to: Be an excellent communicator, written and verbal at senior management level down to individual technical teams and possess the ability to tailor the vision and messages appropriately to the given audience whilst preserving strategic intent. Ability to operate in matrix teams, and influence direction and strategy of technology organisation; Must be able to demonstrate a good understanding of the different core infrastructure components used by the bank to deliver service to the business and be able to apply strategic context to each. Articulate vision and influence senior decision makers across Enterprise Technology and key stakeholders across Technology & Innovation more broadly. Ideally have experience and understanding of operations and experience of transition of products to service. Strategy Own and develop the Technology Strategy that underpins the products, services and capabilities we deliver as an organisation. This includes data centres, networks, storage, compute, web, mainframe, cloud, desktop, communication, security technology services and ITSM Ops. Provide the product level lifecycle roadmap and governance as well as the emerging technology roadmap. Implement a maturity model to provide ongoing assessment of technology capability across each of the Domains within Technology Services. Establish metrics and key performance indicators to measure the impact of transformation. Monitor and report on performance and use insights to form a continuous improvement cycle. Own the organisational engagement plan for the transformation agenda. Excellent understanding of the Group's business strategy and model appropriate to the role. Business Influences the Enterprise Technology delivery responses and solutions to critical business problems Synthesise complex technical and non-functional requirements from a variety of sources to present a considered solution to any identified issues. Ensure solutions maintain an appropriate balance between cost, risk, security, and service, and that any trade-offs are clearly articulated Forge deep relationships with CIO business lines to understand their project deliverables and ensure full alignment with the Enterprise Technology project portfolio. Work with stakeholders to define business and technical requirements for new technology implementations and build support for these business cases. Create a business value centric model of incremental delivery against business priorities to demonstrate value of both the strategy and its concrete deliverables. Drive a systematic approach to communication and training with key stakeholders and partners to lift the level of awareness of cost drivers, opportunities and risks, and future planning needs. Job_Title: Enterprise Account Leader, Asia Pacific (Real Estate)
Job_Descriptions: Who we are Johnson Controls is the global leader for smart, healthy and sustainable buildings. At Johnson Controls, we’ve been making buildings smarter since 1885, and our capabilities, depth of innovation experience, and global reach have been growing ever since. Today, we offer the world’s largest portfolio of building products, technologies, software, and services; we put that portfolio to work to transform the environments where people live, work, learn and play.This is where Johnson Controls comes in, helping drive the outcomes that matter most. Through a full range of systems and digital solutions, we make your buildings smarter. Sustainability is a top priority for our company. We committed to invest 75 percent of new product development R&D in climate-related innovation to develop sustainable products and services. We take sustainability seriously. Achieving net zero carbon emissions before 2040 is just one of our commitments to making the world a better place. You will drive the overall direction of Johnson Controls’ growth strategy and key initiatives, by leveraging his/her existing relations and domain knowledge in the real estate industry, within the built environment. Role will report to the VP - Enterprise Accounts (Asia Pacific). Develop a comprehensive account strategy covering key aspects of customer’s growth plan, Johnson Controls’ response with key initiatives, and overall engagement plan to drive growth. Own and deliver the quarterly sales targets covering orders and margin, across all lines of businesses within Johnson Controls. Position early during design stage by taking a solutions approach, to ensure customer needs are translated into a strong value proposition. Drive proposal competitiveness with engineering and country sales teams, injecting customer and market insights to ensure high win-rate. Build relations with key stakeholders at customer’s organization to position Johnson Controls’ as a preferred partner. Develop and execute strategic initiatives around sustainability, net-zero as a service, digitalization, and solution development to take a holistic approach of engaging broader challenges in the market place, in a both sell-to- and sell-with motion to maximize customers’ strengths. Forge Master Service Agreements to drive technical and commercial standardization, across all businesses and countries. Partner with post-sales teams in project execution, program management and services to ensure customers get right support with highest NPS. Build and maintain account plan with monthly reporting at leadership level; constantly align with regional and global stakeholders. What we look for: Minimum 10 years in front line sales, account management, proposals, engineering and business development roles Minimum 5 years of experience working in real estate industry with specific domain knowledge in building automation, fire & security or HVAC Electrical contracting or technology background will be viewed favourably Solutions selling mindset with a pragmatic approach of driving deal closure Excellent English oral, written and presentation skills with ability to present to senior level executives as well represent the company at public or industry events Ability to comprehend and make significant contributions to development of business plans, including marketing strategies Entrepreneurial attitude, leadership abilities and ability to be a team player at all levels Culturally sensitive Strong business and analytical skills Demonstrate the ability to work effectively within and across direct management lines (in a matrix environment) Customer focus oriented Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate with all levels within the organisation as well as with business partners Ability to make decisions individually and/or as part of a team High levels of integrity, honesty and professionalism Diversity & Inclusion Our dedication to diversity and inclusion starts with our values. We lead with integrity and purpose, focusing on the future and aligning with our customers’ vision for success. Our High-Performance Culture ensures that we have the best talent that is highly engaged and eager to innovate.  Our D&I mission elevates each employee’s responsibility to contribute to our culture. It’s through these contributions that we’ll drive the mindsets and behaviors we need to power our customers’ missions. You have the power. You have the voice. You have the culture in your hands.

Job_Title: VP, Functional Business Analyst (Channels & Digitalisation), Group Retail & Channel T&O
Job_Descriptions: VP, Functional Business Analyst (Channels & Digitalisation), Group Retail & Channel T&O VP, Functional Business Analyst (Channels & Digitalisation), Group Retail & Channel T&O Posting Date: 30-Jan-2022 Location: Raffles Place, Singapore, SG Company: United Overseas Bank Limited About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values - Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches. Job Responsibilities Stakeholder Relationship Management o Support Biz T&O Head (Customer Assisted Channels) for projects in pipeline, pre-project planning activities and prioritization of Quarterly Release system enhancements. o Be a trusted advisor for Group Channels & Digitalisation (GCD) for all new business demands requiring technology or operations enablement/solution and able to co-create Business roadmaps with GCD. o Support business on strategies for Customer Assisted Channels such as Branches, Self-Serve Machines by building relationships with GCD, Technology and Operations teams Requirement Analysis, Elicitation & High-Level Solution o Collaborate with business product owner/specialist to ensure all aspects of the business requirements are defined and analysed. o Analyse & document "to be" processes based on agreed requirements and/or function points. o Analyse & define detailed functional & non-functional requirements based on requirements o Perform impact assessment, develop high level solution and estimation in consultation with architects, technology and operation teams to illustrate feasibility of achieving desired business outcomes o Monitor and manage risks /issues related to requirements and scope creep. Change Implementation Planning and Management o Undertake scoping and evaluation of new initiatives. Defining overall considerations, including scalability, maintainability, costs, operations and technology principal risk to provide a recommendation to business. o Lead and collaborate with cross-functional and technical teams including system analysts, solution architects, technology development teams, and testing teams in defining/clarifying/finalizing requirements. o Work effectively with technology & operation teams on the smooth delivery of the solution. o Review & transition functional specifications document with system analysts, test strategy, support User Acceptance Test with test managers and other relevant stakeholders o Ensure the alignment on how new operation & technical capabilities will be delivered to users with respect to business perspective. o Work with Test Manager to translate business requirements into test scenarios o Facilitate / provide "Train the Trainer" on application enhancements o Maintain up-to-date knowledge base related to application features and processes (subject matter expertise) o Identify potential risks, assess the risk implication and propose risk mitigation strategies. "Run' the bank and Risk Management o Manage the communication and regular updates with GCD stakeholders on 'critical' production incidents and problems impacting customers and branch operations. o Lead the regular review with GCD on system stability, responsiveness, production incident, problem tickets including identification of root cause and preventive measures. o Monitoring the fulfilment of service levels between GTO and GCD and highlighting required actions to close gaps where necessary. o Lead and manage the review of GCD applications/systems with technology teams to propose risk mitigation actions and/or plans prior to business engagement. Job Requirements Master / Bachelor Degree in Engineering / Business / Finance or equivalent Minimum of 10 years of relevant banking and/or consulting experience Strong business domain experience and knowledge in Assisted Channels and Transformation, Branches & Self-Service Banking, Self-Service Machines (ATM, CDM and etc), Omni-Channels and Customer Experience Design. Contact Centre and telesales knowledge is a plus Strong quantitative, analytical, problem solving and process design skills that can translate analysis into solutions that meet business objectives Understanding of technology and operational processes across functions / departments in the bank/market. Resourceful team player Familiar with change management processes and project management fundamentals Strategic forward thinking approach to challenges with outstanding communications, influencing, negotiating and persuasion skills Passionate, diligent and resilient individual with ability to thrive in ambiguity Experience in scoping and evaluation - Defining overall considerations, including scalability, maintainability, cost, operations and technology principal risk to provide a recommendation Project management of business-as-usual and minor/ tactical initiatives Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.
